intro: Heptapleurum subracemosum, commonly known as the clustered holly or Chinese holly, is a species of evergreen shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, upright growth habit and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for birds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
